wikipedia_data.title: Francesco Perez
biography_paragraphs: Francesco Perez was an 18th-century Italian abbot and mathematician, whose work Tri-lichanon goni-arith-metron, describing a goniometer (instrument for measurement of angles), was published in 1781.[1] He later published a letter complaining about the "plagiarizing usurpation" of this invention by Eliseo della Concezione.[2][3]
This article about an Italian mathematician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
